docs.snippet: Most major league teams are having an identity crisis this season, hovering just a few games above or below .500, and that may give the Yankees hope....
docs.lead_paragraph: Most major league teams are having an identity crisis this season, hovering just a few games above or below .500, and that may give the Yankees hope.
docs.abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column observes that most major league baseball teams are hovering just a few games above or below .500, giving the struggling New York Yankees hope.

headline.main: Parity Could Be a Plus for the So-So Yankees
headline.print_headline: Parity Could Be Plus for So-So Yanks

docs.snippet: Catcher Brian McCann, who signed a big contract in the off-season but came into the game hitting .220, homered and tripled, driving in five runs in the Yankees’ victory....
docs.lead_paragraph: Catcher Brian McCann, who signed a big contract in the off-season but came into the game hitting .220, homered and tripled, driving in five runs in the Yankees’ victory.
docs.abstract: New York Yankees defeat Toronto Blue Jays, 7-3, with help from catcher Brian McCann, who signed a five-year, $85 million contract in the off-season.

headline.main: A Struggling McCann Shows Some of the Pop He Was Signed to Provide
headline.print_headline: A Struggling McCann Shows Some of the Pop He Was Signed to Provide

docs.lead_paragraph: Bartolo Colon recorded his first hit in nine years, scored his first run in 12 years, and pitched eight innings to lead the Mets past the Cardinals.
docs.abstract: New York Mets pitcher Bartolo Colon records his first hit in nine years, scores his first run in 12 years and pitches eight innings to lead the team to a 3-2 victory over St Louis Cardinals.

headline.main: A Rare Double, Even by the Mets’ Standards, Helps Prevent a Sweep
headline.print_headline: A Base Hit 9 Years Coming Lifts the Mets

docs.snippet: As it becomes trendy, soccer is losing its old frisson of hooliganism....
docs.lead_paragraph: As it becomes trendy, soccer is losing its old frisson of hooliganism.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by author Philip Delves Broughton charges that soccer, in process of becoming trendy pastime around world, is losing its old hooligan edge; laments that while games have become safer and more inclusive affairs, especially during this year's World Cup, they have lost some of their passion and color; adds that those who grew up around old, raucous games bring hard-won passion to sport that new fans can never have.

headline.seo: World Cup Reflections on Soccer of Old
